intro: Crotalaria flavicoma var. major, commonly known as the yellow crotalaria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Fabaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows as an erect annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its flowers are arranged in racemose inflorescences and are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The seeds are enclosed in pods and can be dispersed by wind or animals, contributing to its spread in suitable habitats.
